GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Unrestricted access (institution did not respond within six months)

ConsentGroup.title: Health/Medical/Biomedical (MDS)
ConsentGroup.name: HMB-MDS
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of this data is limited to health/medical/biomedical purposes, does not include the study of population origins or ancestry. Use of the data includes methods development research (e.g., development of software or algorithms).

StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: Genentech whole-genome sequencing of a non-small cell lung carcinoma
StudyInfo.Description: Whole genome sequencing was applied to tumor and adjacent normal lung tissue in an individual non-small-cell lung cancer patient. We present an analysis of somatic changes identified throughout the tumor genome, including single-nucleotide variants, copy number variants, and large-scale chromosomal rearrangements. Over 50,000 high-confidence single-nucleotide variants were identified, revealing evidence of substantial smoking-related DNA damage as well as distinct mutational pressures within the tumor resulting in uneven distribution of somatic mutations across the genome.
StudyInfo.StudyHistory: A 51-year-old Caucasian male with poorly differentiated non-small-cell lung adenocarcinoma was selected for this study. The patient reported smoking an average of 25 cigarettes a day for 15 years prior to tumor excision.

Header.title: Principal Investigator
Header.Institution: Department of Bioinformatics and Computational Biology, Genentech Inc., South San Francisco, CA, USA

ConsentGroup.title: Biomedical Research Use
ConsentGroup.name: BRU
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of data is limited to scientific research relevant to learn about, prevent or treat health problems, including applications proposing analytical methods, software or other research tool development. Investigators may publish findings derived from the dataset as long as personal data is kept confidential.
